Description: Genuine BMW ///M Drivers Club Edition V Watch !!! Discontinued model from the 1990's. Limited edition to 555 pieces ever made. Ultra rare as in top condition and complete with original plastic and cartoon box. Made in Germany.A light alloy case (allergen free) with a silver matte finish and a mineral crystal glass will safeguard your precious timepiece for many years to come. The deep black dial with superimposed stainless steel hour markers, crisp white Arabic numerals, the speedometer design found on the BMW ///M cars from the 1990's and BMW M Drivers Club logotype next to the date in window at 6 o'clock, will make this timepiece an eye catcher at every sporty event and daily life. The red hour and minute hands, complement the Motorsport racing design. A stainless steel screw-in back, makes the watch water resistant to 3 ATM. It is secured on your wrist with black fine leather band which closes with a stainless steel buckle. Superb Motorsport racing design. The dial represents the speedometer of the BMW ///M5 !!! High quality Japan Made analog quartz movement Specifications of quartz movement:caliber: Miyota 2115type of quartz: tuning fork type quartz crystal frequency : 32,768Hz type of battery: Silver oxide SR626SW or equivalentbattery life: approximately 3 yearsdriving system: two-pole stepping motorFunctions of quartz movement:3 hands: hours, minutes and secondsquick date change by turning crown; date at 6 o'clock Powercell Saving Reset Mechanism(PSRM)Over-loading Compensation Device(OLCD)Digital Frequency Control(DFC) for time adjustmentAny question, please ask BEFORE buying !!! Water Resistance ....a never-ending source of misunderstandings often caused by the irresponsible advertising of certain competitors, who are usually the ones to refuse any responsibility when damage by water occurs. Here are the facts in plain English: 1. Every known brand submits the watch to a 2-phase test in a chamber, where it has to withstand to pressure for the minimum length of time required by industrial standards. It may seem a paradox, but low pressure-resistance, say at 0.5 bar equivalent to 50 cm depth is more critical to achieve, because increasing pressure tends to compress the seals, thereby increasing the resistance; the second phase test conducted at 3 bar (30 m.) is confirmatory. Because of a solid case-construction, the known brands watches will resist to 10 bar (100 m. or 300 ft) and we could confidently call it a «diver’s watch» 2. HOWEVER: The water resistance of a wristwatch is constantly challenged by mechanical wear caused by bumps, shocks etc., rapid changes in temperature, caustic acids, chemicals, etc. and can therefore not be guaranteed as a permanent condition. I renounces to using inflationary «theoretical» claims; the decision to wear your valuable timepiece for swimming, diving or in the Sauna is yours. On a side-note: only very few specially trained and equipped divers reach depths of 100 m and wear professional computers to indicate the life-saving compression- and decompression data; at such depths, normal watches will just not do. Thanks for looking and buying a great and unique item. Have a great day !!!
